description: A unified, multi-dimensional taxonomy of human activities covering pleasure, growth, connection, embodiment, meaning, and contribution.

categories.description: Fallback category for events that do not clearly fit any other primary category.
Activities pursued for immediate pleasure, joy, amusement, and light engagement without obligation or long-term goals.
Activities driven by novelty, discovery, movement into unfamiliar places/ideas, and the thrill of the unknown (from gentle exploration to high-adrenaline adventure).

activities.name: Explore a new neighborhood on foot
Try a random caf/spot youve never entered
Library discovery day (pick books at random)
Day trip to a nearby city
Slow travel (staying longer in one place)
Travel with a theme (food, art, history)
Language immersion day (only speak target language)
Try a cuisine youve never had
Cooking a cuisine youve never cooked
Night walk in a safe lively area
Escape room in a new district
Travel planning as a game (optimize routes)
Try a new sport in a new place
Philosophy walk (one question for an hour)
Try a new genre of fiction (weird/experimental)

categories.description: Activities focused on producing something newart, stories, objects, performances, or digital creationsprimarily for self-expression, joy, and bringing ideas into existence.

activities.name: Basic DIY repairs (fix something at home)
Cook a dish from a new cuisine
Create a photo aesthetic / feed theme

categories.description: Activities pursued primarily for curiosity, understanding, cognitive stimulation, and the pleasure of making sense of the world, ideas, systems, or oneself.
Activities driven by the need to connect with others, feel accepted, share experiences, build relationships, and belong to groups or communities.
Activities centered on bodily awareness, movement, physical effort, sensory engagement, and the pleasure of feeling alive through the body.
Activities driven by the desire to test limits, improve skills, overcome difficulty, measure progress, and experience mastery, achievement, and self-efficacy.
Activities focused on resting the mind and nervous system, reducing stress, disengaging from pressure, and temporarily escaping demands through calm, pleasure, or immersion.
Activities focused on understanding who you are, what you value, how you change over time, and how you make meaningthrough reflection, philosophy, spirituality, and intentional life design.
Activities driven by the desire to contribute beyond oneself, help others, improve systems, create positive change, and leave a meaningful impact or legacy.
